entry.title: iwa: Add Scoped*IsolatedWebApp::InstallChecked
entry.content:
This adds an InstallChecked function that will CHECK that the install

succeeded, and print the error message if it didn't. It's easy to call

.value() on the base::expected returned by Install, but it doesn't

provide good error messages when the install fails. InstallChecked

makes it so the lazy option still provides a good developer experience.

entry.title: [MagicStack] ModuleRegistry shouldn't be a singleton class.
entry.content:
In this CL:

1) ModuleRegistry is created by ChromeTabbedActivity, and is

plumbed to magic stack. This allows one ModuleRegistry per

ChromeActivity, and is safe to register builder instances based on

the ChromeActivity's data, like TabModel. A refactor is done to

plumb the ModuleRegistry instance to Start surface | NTP.

2) Move some static APIs from ModuleRegistry to singleton class

HomeModulesConfigManager. It allows HomeModulesConfigSettings to

access the set of configurable modules.

3) Replace ModuleProviderBuilder#isEligible() with a new

ModuleConfigChecker interface. It allows the details remain in each

module builder.

entry.title: Reland "Ignore drag events while waiting to exit a nested run loop."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d933cbd269533f69b334f8a3d7c32c00b8211240



The test in the CL failed on Wayland, where move loops are not necessarily a thing; in the reland I skip the test if move loops are not supported.



Original change's description:

> Ignore drag events while waiting to exit a nested run loop.

>

> Background: When dragging tabs into another window, TabDragController exits the nested run loop that was handling the window drag and resumes handling the drag session within the original, parent run loop. But that is not an atomic event - it must return control and wait for the nested run loop to exit. If any additional calls into TabDragController::Drag happen between TabDragController asking to exit the run loop and that nested run loop actually exiting, TabDragController could do unexpected things while handling those events. Notably, if it tried to start another nested run loop, this would CHECK.

>

> This CL extends TabDragController's DragState state enum to explicitly model this interval with a `kWaitingToExitRunLoop` state, so it can ignore calls to Drag during this interval.

>

> It's worth noting that some platforms (Chrome OS and Linux) will use this new state, and others (Windows and Mac) will not because they instead already use the kWaitingToDragTabs state during the same interval. These are modeled separately because they correspond to very different underlying states for the drag session - see the comments on the enum values for details.

>

> Bug: 41493121

> Change-Id: I803f962dfcf3ebc5d37fed964f9b40c1e5922711

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5278227

> Commit-Queue: Taylor Bergquist

> Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258839}

entry.title: [Structured Metrics] Flush events on shutdown
entry.content:
There is currently a limitation on Chrome where all events are lost on

shutdown because all events are stored in-memory. This resolves that

issue by flushing events when the Structured Metrics Service is

destroyed. Additionally, adding functionality to attempt to send a log if one is stored in the log store when the service is started.



NO_BUG

entry.title: Delete `//chrome/services/qrcode_generator`.
entry.content:
After go/rusty-qr-code-generator we no longer need a separate service

that delegates QR code generation to a separate process. Therefore this

CL deletes the `//chrome/services/qrcode_generator` directory.



* `qr_code_generator_pixeltest.cc` has been moved to

`//chrome/browser/sharing` (as I am not sure if pixel tests are

supported for `components_browsertests` - this has been discussed in

https://crrev.com/c/5278872/8#message-5b43795fe4019875ebb87e19e95b49e08947133b).

* Code that draws a QR code into a `SkBitmap` has been moved from

`//chrome/services/qrcode_generator/qrcode_generator_service_impl.*`

to `//components/qr_code_generator/bitmap_generator.*`.

* `qrcode_generator.mojom` has been deleted:

* Bitmap style enums (e.g. `LocatorStyle`) have been moved into

`//components/qr_code_generator/bitmap_generator.h`

* Error codes have been moved into

`//components/qr_code_generator/qr_code_generator.h`

* Fields of `GenerateQRCodeRequest` have been "splat" into

parameters of the new `GenerateBitmap` function

* `GenerateQRCodeResponse` has been replaced with a new

`QRImage` struct plus `base::expected`

* `QRImageGenerator` class has been deleted and its method

has been refectored:

* The method became a free function

* The result is now returned directly instead of via a callback



This CL is quite big - I appologize. Splitting this CL into smaller

pieces is a bit difficult, mostly because it seems hard to defining some

types in `.mojom` and some in `.h`.



Bug: 40263739

entry.title: Make Page colors prefs non-sync
entry.content:
This CL removes the sync feature for page colors prefs, which was

introduced in CL:3770806. Page colors is an accessibility setting that

simulates Forced Colors Mode at browser level. However, syncing the

prefs across devices caused undesired behavior[1].



This CL aims to make Page colors prefs non-synced(i.e. only applies to

the current device and profile).



[1]: crbug.com/1510093

entry.title: Reland "[IBAN][Clank] Update PersonalDataManager class"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit ddb8018d0bfc64dc9ecac88b6ac75990fb0fd49d



Reason for failure: it seems assertions don't run on android in prod so the three tests that verify that an assertion was thrown return ```expected java.lang.AssertionError to be thrown, but nothing was thrown```. Logs can be found here https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/android-arm-tests. For the fix, I removed the assertion tests since assertions aren't guaranteed to work in android prod and changed assertionError in the code, especially that per go/java-practices/assertions, it's not recommended to have any assertionError in unit tests since they might not execute as expected in prod.

entry.title: media/gpu: Optimize MM21 shaders
entry.content:
Vectorize the MM21 detiling calculations. The MM21 detiling shader

performs bilinear filtering, so it needs to fetch 4 texels from the

source texture. Previously, the coordinates of these texels were

calculated one at a time. This CL batches the coordinate calculations

of all 4 texels together to take better advantage of the GPU's SIMD

nature.



Re-use tileIdx for the UV coordinate calculations. Because the numerator

and denominator in this calculation are both divided by two, this value

is actually shared between both luma and chroma detiling calculations.



Replace division with multiplication by inverse, and modulo with

multiplication and subtraction. Division is extremely slow on GPUs, so

even though this technique requires extra arithmetic operations, it

results in a significant performance gain.



VulkanImageProcessorPerfTest reports an FPS change from ~125FPS to

~250FPS. The load for detiling, rotating, and scaling a 720P video dropped from ~20% GPU usage to ~9% GPU usage.



Bug: b:304781371

Test: Tested by running

ImageProcessorPerfTest.VulkanImageProcessorPerfTest and

ImageProcessorTest.VulkanDetileScaleTest on MT8188.



Change-Id: I49cb79d323521d9b8dc1deeb081f9fd640ebafa3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5288635

entry.title: viz: Don't treat renderer-backed solid color overlays like RPDQ overlays
entry.content:
We recently landed a change crrev.com/c/5270295 that moved lifetime

management of in-flight RPDQ overlay buffers into OverlayLock. Solid

color overlay buffers (used on Lacros-on-Linux) used OverlayLock just

to store mailboxes to lookup in |solid_color_buffers_| later, but this

causes a crash because the previously mentioned CL now tries to treat

them as RPDQ overlays.



This CL adds an overload to OverlayLock so the solid color buffers can

continue using it to just store the mailbox. Solid color buffer

lifetimes will be managed outside of OverlayLock, as it currently is.



Bug: 325107803

Change-Id: I2d80d28639164605a1fa3d41be36e5e127475935

entry.title: Add IsolationInfo::CreateTransientWithNonce().
entry.content:
Rrestricting untrusted network requests from fenced frames requires

tagging them with a unique per-frame value, and fenced frames already

have one: the nonce. In future CLs, the network service will be

able to identify network requests by the nonce in the

IsolationInfo/NetworkIsolationKey and cancel them if they originated

from fenced frames with a matching nonce.



Tagging transient IsolationInfos with the fenced frame nonce allows

requests that originated from a fenced frame to be identified, even

if they do not map to a particular origin. This is necessary to

fully disable untrusted network requests in fenced frames. Providing

the nonce here does not meaningfully change existing resource

partitioning because transient IsolationInfos already have an opaque

origin, and therefore an opaque NetworkIsolationKey.



Change-Id: I028598a1ff56b71eca691770a0b7bacca3758718

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260238

become more interchangeable.

entry.title: [ios][TipsNotifications] Store Tips notification opt-in in local state
entry.content:
The price tracking and commerce push notification opt-in states are

stored in BrowserState prefs because those features are connected to a

user account. But Tips notifications are not connected to an account,

and apply to the device as a whole (ex. Default Browser notification).



This change stores Tips opt-in / permitted state in local state prefs,

and changes the TipsNotificationClient to observe this pref so that it

can set up the first notification request when opting-in, or clear any

requests when opting-out.

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Remove duplicate GpuMemoryBufferId function
entry.content:
PlatformVideoFramePool's function GpuMemoryBufferId() did pretty much

the same thing as GetSharedMemoryId() in platform_video_frame_utils.h.



One cosmetic difference is that GpuMemoryBufferId() returns

GpuMemoryBufferId, which is an alias of GenericSharedMemoryId.

GetSharedMemoryId() returns GenericSharedMemoryId. Another difference

is that GetSharedMemoryId() works an additional frame storage type:

VideoFrame::STORAGE_DMABUF. However, that feature is not important.



This removes GpuMemoryBufferId() from PlatformVideoFramePool in favor of

GetSharedMemoryId(). Doing so cleans up the PlatformVideoFramePool

class.

entry.title: Move PlusAddress suggestion creation into PlusAddress service.
entry.content:
Over time, plus address suggestion creation will become more

complicated: Affiliations will need to be taken into account and there

can be multiple suggestions.



This CL moves suggestion creation into //components/plus_addresses,

where this logic should naturally live. Doing so allows to decrease

the API surface that plus_addresses needs to inject into autofill

at the expense of adding more autofill dependencies to plus_addresses.

This is the intended dependency direction.

entry.title: [bookmarks] Plumb metric suffixes for account bookmarks
entry.content:
The case where a dedicated BookmarkModel instance is used was

implemented before this patch, but the scenario where a single

BookmarkModel instance contains a mix requires refactoring the

BookmarkClient API to avoid treating metrics::StorageStateForUma as a

property of a BookmarkModel instance.



The solution proposed here is to replace the existing API in

BookmarkClient with one that determines whether or not sync (the

feature) is on. This allows BookmarkModel to determine, on a per-node

basis, what the StorageStateForUma is.



The approach builds on top of https://crrev.com/c/5277130 because

BookmarkModel needs to know if `this` is the special, iOS-only

instance where account bookmarks have been loaded into a dedicated

BookmarkModel instance.



Metric breakdowns for Bookmarks.Storage.TimeToLoadAtStartup2 become

somewhat meaningless (with platform-specific particularities) and are

hence removed.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Bookmarks.Storage.TimeToLoadAtStartup2.LocalStorageSyncing]=Meaningless outside iOS

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Bookmarks.Storage.TimeToLoadAtStartup2.LocalStorage]=Meaningless outside iOS OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Bookmarks.Storage.TimeToLoadAtStartup2.AccountStorage]=Meaningless outside iOS



Change-Id: I42dce63e003cc1fa0e56934f95bef7cb152b25ac

entry.title: Delay processing of cross-site prefetch responses.
entry.content:
For cross-site prefetches, it is delayed by the time between the

start of sending the request and the processing response headers,

which is the time the request would take if it were already

preconnected.



In Chrome, the DSE is exempt because this site is more likely

to do these requests and is trusted to do many of this sort of

navigation already.



A base::Feature is included, as are unit and browser tests.

entry.title: [User Education] Automatically ensure FET initialization in most cases
entry.content:
This removes a common pitfall of using a "live" Feature Engagement

Tracker when testing some IPH, in which FET initialization could run in

parallel with the test and potentially race showing the promo, which

could then cause the IPH to fail to show during some test runs.



Previously, it was necessary to explicitly wait for the FET to

initialize (using one of a number of utilities, or rolling your own

code with a RunLoop). However, having to know and remember to do this

resulted in a number of tests which did not have the required code and

could therefore flake.



Now, when using InteractiveFeatureEngagementTest and specifying

UseDefaultTrackerAndEnableFeatures, the default behavior is to wait for

the FET to initialize before running the body of the test.



You can override this behavior by explicitly specifying

TrackerInitializationMode::kDoNotWait. There is copious documentation

in the relevant header files about when it might be advantageous to use

this mode. In practice this is rare.



Still to do:

- Create a "CheckPromoShown(promo, shown)" verb

- Make certain test verbs work InAnyContext()

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Fix crash by verifying extension existence
entry.content:
Toolbar actions model removes actions from its list when the extension

is unloaded. When an extension is reloaded, registry moves the

extension from the enabled to the disabled set and triggers an observer that uses IsRestrictedUrl(). At this point, action_ids() could include a

disabled extension that hasn't been removed yet due to race conditions.



Thus, we should skip the extension if it's not found to avoid any

crashes.

entry.title: Improve performance of CreateAnchorElementMetrics
entry.content:
We have several cases of unnecessary string copies. When determining

whether an anchor has text siblings, we compute `wholeText` only to

check if it's empty. We now inline the traversal done by `wholeText`

without actually building the string. `IsSameHost` compares the

KURL::Host of two URLs. We can use a StringView here. To do so, we add

an equivalent StringView method for the host to KURL.



Some computations are duplicated between CreateAnchorElementMetrics

and its caller. We move the logic for skipping metrics for a given

anchor into CreateAnchorElementMetrics and have a null return value

indicate that it should be skipped. In the main frame case, we

compute two bounding boxes--with and without overflow, the former for

size metrics computation and the latter for skipping empty anchors.

These bounding box computations are rather expensive, so we use the

overflow version for the empty anchor check as well. For the subframe

case, the overflow version isn't otherwise needed, so we calculate

the bounding box without overflow for the empty check as this version

is faster to compute.



From local testing on my workstation, together these changes take

the computation of metrics on the youtube home page from 9.7ms to

5.5ms.



Bug: 40258405

Change-Id: Ia3e4f71779dce7c9a271d7a5bd1fe4e0da8c6c8b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5275282

Reviewed-by: Jeremy Roman

entry.title: Use IEEE 1284 data for USB printer setup
entry.content:
Some printers have generic or non-unique entries in their USB string

descriptors. In many cases, they do have the expected per-model

values in the IEEE 1284 GET_DEVICE_ID response. UsbPrinterDetector is

already collecting this data to check for supported PDLs, but it doesn't

use it for PPD lookups. By adding this to the existing set of

make_and_model strings, we can look for per-model PPDs instead of the

generic names. This is unlikely to make any of these printers work

immediately, but will allow us to start seeing the real model info when

evaluating support requests.



Bug: b/271572497

Test: Plug in an Epson Stylus Photo R300

entry.title: Plumb ColorProviderColorMaps through WebView::Create()
entry.content:
This CL plumbs color maps required to construct color providers in the

renderer process through WebView::Create() down to page creation. This

ensures that every Page has valid color provider instances and avoids

crashes when painting with a null color provider. This change was

motivated by a Lacros crash caused by this issue[1].



To handle places that do not use the normal machinery to create a Page,

such as tests or non-ordinary pages, a default set of color maps is

used to construct the color provider instances for the Page.

Non-ordinary pages are pages that are not associated with a web view.

They are used for specific purposes such as svg images, overlays and

some internal pages.



[1]: https://crbug.com/1519536



Bug: 1430181

Change-Id: Ie61702297f9e091542a6cfed67b4aff0bb992fab

entry.title: [SAA] Include unpartitioned cookies in DedicatedWorker load if StorageAccess was granted
entry.content:
We should include SameSite=None cookies that will be available when the

worker fetches when the worker loads. This aligns with the work done in:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4968438

to fill in a missing case where cookies should be included.



This still requires the third-party frame creating the DedicatedWorker

already had StorageAccess granted.



Security Considerations:

We have to pass the hasStorageAccess bool from the renderer as only

it knows if cookie access (and not just some other storage access) was

granted, but we verify this in the browser process by checking if there

is a record of a storage access grant. There's a single permission here,

STORAGE_ACCESS, and if it was granted then the renderer has access to

any forms of unpartitioned storage without spawning dedicated workers.

For that reason, it's okay to trust the renderer when it says it needs

unpartitioned cookies specifically, as long as we check if the

underlying permission was actually granted.



Bug: 325029895, b:299515369, 1495169

Change-Id: I57575392b72955088435f095b0087acef0143777

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293896

entry.title: [//content] Add histogram for GPU process launch mode fallback causes
entry.content:
GPU process launch mode fallback can concurrently occur for two reasons:

* Failure to initialize the GPU process (in which case fallback happens

immediately and there is no GPU process crash generated)

* An overflow of the maximum number of GPU process crashes that are

allowed to happen within a given time period



This CL adds a histogram distinguishing the two causes. Together with

other histograms that followup CLs will add, this will aid in our

ability to understand fallback behavior (in particular as we continue

to roll out Graphite).



Bug: 40948503

Change-Id: Iad59051979145281a3941dc679d531da82bf486d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5290554

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

Reviewed-by: Kyle Charbonneau

Commit-Queue: Jonathan Ross

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1261121}

entry.title: Remove AutofillEnableParsingEmptyPhoneNumberLabels
entry.content:
The idea was to add rules to the phone number parsing logic matching

empty labels, to classify composite phone number inputs like

Phone

where the second has an empty label.



However, the way label extraction works, the DOM needs to be structured

extremely weirdly for only the first field to have a label.



Removing this rule/changing indices breaks the

Autofill.FieldPrediction.PhoneNumberGrammarUsage metric, which tracked

the index of the rule that matched. This metric was intended to help

understand whether the new rules match anyways, so it can safely be

removed.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Autofill.FieldPrediction.PhoneNumberGrammarUsage]=As

explained above.



Bug: b/40100455

Change-Id: I872dce80d8564edb8a28b5aaea3604c96f04e246

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300581

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

entry.title: [Autofill][Android] Enable AutofillProfilesFragmentTest.
entry.content:
This CL fixed several issues in the AutofillProfilesFragmentTest:

* Honorific prefixes were removed from Clank. This CL removes all

attempts to set honorific prefix in the tests.



* Profile list in AutofillProfilesFragment is rebuilt after every

notification from the PersonalDataManager. This notification can fire

several times. The tests mainly wait for the notification to fire once.

Since the tests and UI changes are executed in different threads, there

is a data race condition. This CL moves all UI preference accesses to

the UI thread. This way, the code is guaranteed to have a list of

preferences without changes from other threads.



* There was also no synchronization between the moment the test clicks

on the editor "Done" or "Cancel" button and the test waiting for the

preference list to get updated. That's why the tests were failing

because of the callback waiting timeout. The way to fix this is to

get the preference update callback count before clicking the button on

the UI thread and then wait to the preference list to get updated once.



Fixed: b:40946214, b:40945738, b:40945737, b:40945736, b:40945735, b:40945733, b:40945732, b:40945731, b:40945730, b:41487945

Change-Id: I82180985703d458949d3b7f2dccd8ac0fa561d03

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300418

Reviewed-by: Friedrich Horschig

entry.title: Enables aggregatable value filtering against source data
entry.content:
Allows trigger-side filtering on applying aggregatable contributions.

The trigger registration can now take in a list of dictionaries for the

aggregatable_values field, with each element containing a dictionary of

key -> aggregatable value pairs as well as a set of filters and not

filters.



We use the existing FilterPair type along with the original aggregatable

key -> values map for parsing and Mojo serialization, but return an

error if an element of the list is not a dictionary or if the expected

inner "values" field is missing.

entry.title: [iOS] Sign-In without using UI
entry.content:
This slightly speed-up tests.

Note that `kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos` is disabled.

So `[SigninEarlGreyUI signinWithFakeIdentity:fakeManagedIdentity]`

enable sync. Hence the only case we can use are the one which

explicitly do not enable sync.
